posts.author: Emperor_Marius
posts.content: Is it worth using a light weapon in the off-hand to reduce penalties or is it more effective to just use two weapons of the same size? As an example, 2 rapiers or rapier and shortsword?

posts.author: Thorsson
posts.content:
In AB terms it's best to use two identical, small weapons, so that you can get EWF on all attacks and suffer no malus from having a non-light weapon in the off-hand. This will outweigh the benefit of having a heavier weapon with a little more damage.

The other option is a double-sided weapon, which counts as a light weapon for the off-hand, but which requires the Exotic Weapon Feat (and is less flexible).

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
A lot will depend on what build you're playing, but a light weapon in the off-hand is always going to be better in AB terms - as Thorsson says (tiny for halfling or gnome, obviously). However, if you've got lots of Fighter and/or CoT levels you might have enough feats to take WF, WS, Imp Crit, EWF, EWS in two different weapons as well as the 3 two-weapon fighting feats. In that case, it's worth thinking about different damage types - slashing in the main hand, piercing or blunt in the off, for example.

Cheers
